intro: Pittosporum macrophyllum, commonly known as the large-leaf pittosporum, is a shrub or small tree native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its broad, glossy, dark green leaves that can grow up to 15 centimeters in length. The plant produces fragrant, white flowers that are clustered in terminal panicles, followed by orange-red berries. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers a sunny to partially shaded location. Pittosporum macrophyllum is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to provide habitat for native wildlife.
